answers.answer: A fasting glucose level of 58 mg/dl is considered below normal; patients are normally considered hypoglycemic. See these links for an explanation.http://www.diabetes.org/type-1-diabetes/hypoglycemia.jspand,http://ehealthforum.com/health/topic65112.htmlDid doctor test your thyroid? This link explores hypoglycemia and thyroid issues.http://ehealthforum.com/health/topic11990.html

question: I am not diabetic and a health, active, slim 58 year old.  Recent blood test showed low glucose levels - 58.  My gynecologist said that I may be pre diabetic and needed to see an internist.  What causes low blood sugar and can it be a sign that I'm pre diabetic?  I eat protein and rarely eat sweets.
title: Low glucose levels
